author: Lesley Waters
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6.  Make a criss-cross in the top of each fig, pinch the base to expand the opening at the top, and stuff each with a Camembert piece. Season, to taste, with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat the butter in a small ovenproof frying pan and fry the figs for one minute. Place the pan into the oven and roast for six minutes, or until the cheeseis melted and golden.  In a separate pan, fry the bacon on both sides for 4-5 minutes, or until crisp. Remove the figs from the oven and wrap each one with a rasher of bacon.  To serve, place the bacon-wrapped figs onto a plate.
ingredients: 3 figs,  50g/3Â½oz Camembert, cut into 3 pieces,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  1 tsp butter,  3 rashers streaky bacon
